title: Vegetarian Tortilla Soup
directions: In a large pot saute the onion in 1 T. of olive oil. When it is tender add in the garlic and jalapeno. Saute for about 2 minutes.
Add in the potato, zucchini, and corn. Saute until veggies are soft.
Pour in the tomatoes and vegetable broth. If you are using plain tomatoes, add in a can of green chiles. Stir well.
Add in fresh cilantro and lime juice.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve hot with toppings.
ingredients: 1 jalapeno, minced (leave out if you don’t like things hot)
1 large russet potato, diced (I left the skin on for more nutrients)
1 bag of frozen corn (use fresh if you have it)
2 15 oz. cans diced tomatoes with green chiles (if you can’t find these, add in a can of green chiles)
3 15 oz. cans of vegetable broth (low sodium, fat free)
